Oknum Polisi yang Terlibat Culik WN Inggris Terancam Diperberat Hukuman
05 Nov 2019, 13:10 by Ahmad Bil Wahid
Jakarta - Polri berjanji memberikan hukuman terhadap oknum polisi yang diduga ikut menculik dan memeras warga negara Inggris Matthew Simon Craib. Polri menyebut oknum polisi itu perlu dihukum dua kali lipat.
"Kalau dia malah mencederai profesinya selaku penegak hukum, pelayan masyarakat, penjamin keamanan, malah jadi pelanggar hukum dan pelaku tindak pidana atau membantu terjadinya suatu hukum pidana harus dihukum keras, dua kali lipat," kata Kadiv Humas Polri, Irjen M Iqbal di Mabes Polri, Jalan Trunojoyo, Jakarta Selatan, Selasa (5/11/2019).
Iqbal mengatakan, saat ini Propam Polri masih melakukan proses terhadap para oknum tersebut. Dia menyebut perbuatan oknum itu bertolak belakang dengan tugas polisi.
"Sedang diproses. Prinsipnya kalau terbukti, ada penegakan hukum, apalagi anggota polisi, gitu kan. Polisi itu pelindung, penegak hukum, pengayom masyarakat," ujarnya.
Sebelumnya diberitakan, penculikan Matthew Simon Craib terjadi pada 30 Oktober 2019. Pelaku penculikan merupakan rekan kerja korban yang memiliki ide jahat itu.
Dalam kasus yang berawal dari laporan polisi bernomor LP/7002/X/2019/PMJ/Ditreskrimum tertanggal 31 Oktober 2019 dengan pelapor VL, rekan Matthew itu, Kabid Humas Polda Metro Jaya Kombes Argo Yuwono, Minggu (3/11/2019) mengatakan ada 6 pelaku yang turut serta melakukan aksi kejahatan itu. Empat pelaku di antaranya merupakan anggota Polri.
Kasus bermula ketika korban Matthew, pada 29 Oktober 2019, memberi tahu rekannya yakni VL bahwa dia ingin bertemu seseorang terkait urusan pekerjaan. Pada 30 Oktober 2019 pukul 02.00 WIB, korban memberitahukan kepada VL sudah dalam perjalanan pulang dan ternyata diketahui diculik dengan para pelaku meminta tebusan sekitar USD 1 juta.
VL lantas membuat laporan pada Kamis (31/10/2019) sekitar pukul 08.00 WIB dan Ditreskrimum Polda Metro Jaya kemudian menindaklanjutinya. Sekitar pukul 13.00 WIB di kawasan Kemayoran, Jakarta Pusat, para pelaku ditangkap.

Police Officers Involved With Kidnapping of British Citizens Threatened to be Punished
05 Nov 2019, 13:10 by Ahmad Bil Wahid
Jakarta - The National Police promised to punish police officers who allegedly participated in kidnapping and blackmailing British citizen Matthew Simon Craib. The National Police said that the police need to be doubled.
"If he even injures his profession as a law enforcer, a public servant, a security guarantor, in fact becomes a law violator and criminal offender or helps the occurrence of a criminal law must be severely punished, doubled," said Head of Police Public Relations, Inspector General M Iqbal at the National Police Headquarters , Jalan Trunojoyo, South Jakarta, Tuesday (11/05/2019).
Iqbal said that currently the National Police Propam was still conducting a process against these individuals. He called the actions of the person contrary to the duties of the police.
"It's being processed. The principle is if proven, there is law enforcement, especially police officers, that's right. The police are protectors, law enforcers, community guards," he said.
Previously reported, the abduction of Matthew Simon Craib occurred on 30 October 2019. The kidnappers were victims' co-workers who had the evil idea.
In a case that began with a police report numbered LP / 7002 / X / 2019 / PMJ / Ditreskrimum dated 31 October 2019 with the VL reporter, Matthew's colleague, the Head of Metro Jaya Police Public Relations Commissioner Argo Yuwono, Sunday (3/11/2019) said there was 6 perpetrators who participated in the crime. Four of these are police officers.
The case began when the victim Matthew, on October 29, 2019, told his colleague VL that he wanted to meet someone related to work matters. On 30 October 2019 at 02.00 WIB, the victim told VL that he was on his way home and it was found that he had been kidnapped with the perpetrators asking for a ransom of around USD 1 million.
VL then made a report on Thursday (10/31/2019) around 08.00 WIB and the Jakarta Police Directorate General Criminal Investigation then followed up on it. At around 1:00 pm West Indonesian Time in the Kemayoran area, Central Jakarta, the perpetrators were arrested.
